list_definition.definition: a wild shrub of the pea family with (usually yellow) flowers

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The hillside was covered in broom.

list_ex_of_english: Are clothes to be excluded, and household requisites like crockery, pots and pans, dusters, brooms, brushes, and so on?
People stepped off aeroplanes wearing coats and carrying buckets and brooms and changed places with others.
Brooms come in a different class from brushes.
However, high planting density also favoured witches' broom incidence.
Apart from the street scavenging brooms, all brushes more than 12¼ inches wide were to be sold to housewives free of tax.
Why is it necessary to import brooms and brushes if our home industry is capable of supplying our own needs and more?
Is the balance of payments running riot simply because the housewives have been buying too many brushes, too many brooms, too many cups and saucers?
We have had exceptions made on brushes and brooms, on shopping baskets and shopping bags for particular reasons.
